completion: Braxius is a dwarven soldier with a grudge.
Eliandra is a city in the clouds.
The Gorax is a giant who loves to dance.
Balin is a stout Mountain Dwarf who can tell the age of stone by tapping it.
Dwalin from Loderoom is a Gem-adorned Shield crafter, who uses pickaxes for art.
Bifur from Tundertop takes pride in dancing the 'Stone Step Shuffle'.
Bofur spends his time in the Dwarven feast hall at Hammerrest, who uses armor polish as cologne.
Bombur works at the Beard-braiding parlor, and uses beard braids as a calendar.
Dori uses gem dust as glitter, and runs the Clan meeting hall
The Axe-swinging Nori is a Battle-hardened, Loyal Quarry overseer from Cragheart.
The Astrologer Ori is a oath-keeping earth-lover from the Engravers' studio at Emberveil.
Deep-voiced Fili owns a proud Alehouse in Stonehold, and has a separate comb for every section of the beard.
The owner of the Underground tavern at Driftstone is tunnel-digger Kili, who can tell a story for each scar.
Feast-loving Oin, owner of the Dwarven inn in Silverstone, famous for it's ornate horn crafting and magma rivers.
Iron-willed Gloin sleeps with a pickaxe under the pillow.
Thorin is a Gem-trader from Fireforge, who has a dance for every type of ore.
Short-statured, tunnel-dwelling Thrain, gazes deep into crystals in Shieldrest.
Thror operates the Dwarven bakery and uses gemstones for mood lighting.
Gold-seeking Frerin has a secret handshake for fellow miners.
The deep-thinking Fundin is a nurse for the Dwarven hospital of Runepeak.
The stocky Nain of Lodeheart is a song-singing Storyteller with a pet rock named 'Pebbles'.
Magma-watching Durin of Nightrock, has a map of every mine ever visited.
Mountain-hailing Dain of the Metalworkers' union has plans for an Underground orchard at Ironmantle.
Borin, Farin's brother, is a mirthful Architect at the town of Rockvein.
Gror, son of Fror, has a favorite type of echo and a sixth sense for detecting cave-ins.
In Stonecutters' alley, Drorin of Deepveil
The jovial Thrar uses armor as pajamas.
Gem appraiser Bruni stands by a rune-etched obelisk
Brolin of Quartzspire uses cave water for the purest brew.
Town Surveyor Dralin of Thundermount thinks trees are just 'temporary stone'.
Nandor serves the Stone tablet archive and plays the 'Boulder Bass'.
The owner of the Magma bathhouse, Thalor of Emberhold, uses rocks for meditation.
Ore-smelting, stone-faced Druin works tirelessly at the stone-carved amphitheater of Flintveil.
Borom stands in the corner of the Armor fitting room.
Lore-keeping Nalur swears he can whistle in Dwarvish.
Thrand tends to the Sculpture garden after a stressful life at the Ore assay office in Stonewatch.
Drandor stands atop the Magma viewing platform as the Clan elder of Steelvein.
Brolur can smell gold from a mile away.
Nalor can name ancestors ten generations back.
Pipe-smoking Fronin of Cragpeak spends his time in the Crystal cave of Kinghold
Forge-master Dralinor of Kingforge has a collection of ancient hammers.
Lawkeeper Borund works at the Dwarven wedding hall, and has a personal vendetta against goblins.
Throrin is a talented Tattoo artist, with a beard care routine.
Nalund fishes by the stone lakes of Ironcore
Drorund lives for the Jewelers' market of Mithrilhall.
Thalund dreams of working the Silver vault of Understone
Frund, a bard from Glimmerforge, enjoys reciting the 'Hymn of the Hearth.'
Anvil-shaping Groinor uses molten metal for art.
The stern Nalin of Anvilveil visit the Mountain shrine of Boulderrock everyday, to pay respects to Throrund of Hearthrock.
Berylla of the Stonecarver's guild is a hammer-wielding, anvil-striking Mountain Dwarf of immense size.
Doriella Uses armor as formal wear.
Norina Can tell the weather by the feel of the stone.
Mead-drinking Orina is the stewardess of the War chariot garage, and can carve runes in seconds with just her hands and a chisel.
Filia believes beardless individuals are just 'unfinished dwarves.'
Down at the Underground fishing hole, Kilia hasn't caught anything for weeks.
Slick with sweat from the Gold smelting furnace, Oina is a bold Silversmith with braided bronze hair.
Armor-clad Gloina is a hardworking cart driver from the metal trading post.
The Metalworker Thorina, daughter of Borina thinks the sun is just a very bright torch.
Thraina from the family hearth room believes the deeper you go, the closer you are to home.
Mason Thora uses coal as a pillow for a good night's sleep.
Gem cutter Frerina uses stalagmites as coat hangers.
Tomb keeper Fundina is an Honorable patron of the Stonemason's Guild of Veinrock.
Shield-bearing Naina has a song for every mountain.
The Cartographer Durina, daughter of Daina, travels from Metalhold to Craghold each day for a tryst with a belt weaver.
Prospector Farina uses beer foam for hair styling.
Clan-bound Grora operates the Ancestral portrait gallery and uses beard beads as a memory aid.
Lookout for the Mountain outpost, Groina uses coal as eyeliner.
Beast tamer Brunia Can play the 'Stone Flute.'
Frora of Underspire is a Stone-sculpting Siege engineer and uses a hammer as a gavel in disputes.
Shield-polishing Thrara can tell the quality of metal by its taste.
Ship captain Drorina uses cave moss for tea.
Brolina of the Magma forge of Hearthhold has a favorite mine temperature.
Fire-taming Dralina is a bold Torchbearer for the city of Steelmount and uses gemstones as reading lights.
Lodestone's own Nandora is a boot-stomping, gem-hoarding hermit, who can recite the 'Saga of the Silver.'
Crafty librarian Thalora has a secret recipe for the perfect ale.
Druina is a greengrocer of the Underground greenhouse of Goldvein.
Oath-swearing Stable master Boroma of Ironcave believes in the 'Great Forge' in the sky.
Nalura uses beard length to measure time.
Judge Thrandra consumes cave mushrooms as a delicacy.
The Historian Drandra can tell tales of the 'Underdeep.'
War-crying Brolura has participated in at least one beard-braiding contest.
Nalora uses gemstones as currency.
Fronina uses a shield as a sled during winter.
Dralinora believes mountains are just oversized hills.
Borunda uses molten lava for a sauna.
Throrina thinks gold is just 'shiny dirt.'
Nalunda uses gemstones as bedtime story material.
Drorunda uses beard braids to store small tools.
Thalunda has a favorite type of dirt.
Frunda can juggle hammers.
Groinora has a favorite type of cave drip.
Nalina believes in the 'Curse of the Copper.'
Throrunda Has a lucky pickaxe.
The esteemed Songwriter Dralunda of Forgepeak basically LIVES for the Dwarven music hall.
Diamondveil's own Borinora brought fame to her family for her outstanding performance at the Gem appraisal office.
Kingstone can only be found by using ore veins as a compass.
Irondeep, famous for the Circle of Stone, who use anvils for weightlifting.
Anvilhome spills with mountaineers at this time of year.
Bronzehall's Underground riverbank is known for the Jewelcave thought to bring fortune to those that enter.
The silver miners at Orecliff, helmet-topped and earth-treading, bustle with activity.
Gemheart's gold chasers are the stuff of legend, filling the coffers of the Dwarven bank vault.
Rockspire's armor-fitting process takes years to finish, and is expensive.
Steelgate's metal benders run the enchanted armour shop out of the deep geode chamber.
Gold-chasing Earthmantle residents contribute to work at the tunnel excavation site.
Hearthstone War-drumming brings drawves from as far as Moltenkeep to witness the festival.
The Brewery at Cragfort, forge-heated by the underground aqueduct.
Rune-studying at Ironspire is considered a 'high dwarf' principal.
Metalbarrow's Dwarven library holds the secrets to hammer forging and metal cooling.
Ale-brewers at Orehold began work at the simple Potion brewing lab of Axehome.
Crystalshaft creates Clan-leading, Gem-setting Shipwright for neighbouring provinces.
At Earthcore, you can get your scroll-read, which is equivalent to tarot readers above ground.
Jewelgate's deep earth meditation chamber is said to reduce the mercury in your blood by a factor of ten
Metaldeep's Underground Zoo creates some of the finest hunters in Orepeak.
Cave-exploring at Rockhold is a fun weekend activity for the Dwarves of Thunderhall.
The Watchtower Undermount serves as the first Battlements of Veintone.
The Lava flow workshop of Boulderhold started as a small group in a Dwarven bakery of Deepforge.
